graph

Represents the global graph object

Properties
nodes

Array of node objects in the graph

container

The HTML container element of the graph

settings

An object containing the graph settings

stats

An object containing graph statistics to display

Functions
getStatsRepresentation
this.getStatsRepresentation = function(
node,
htmlRepresentation
)

Returns the graph per-node statistics.

Note

This function is under construction.

Returns

Returns an object representation of the graph statistics.  If htmlRepresentation=true, an HTML representation of the stats is returned.

size

Returns the number of nodes in the graph.

Usage
var s = graph.size();
Returns

The number of nodes in the graph.

getNode
this.getNode = id =>

Gets a specific node in the graph given its ID.

Usage
var n = graph.getNode('a');
Parameters
id

the ID of the node to get

Returns

The requested node, or null if it does not exist

addNode
this.addNode = _ =>

Adds an empty node to the graph.

Usage
var n = graph.addNode();
Parameters
id

the ID of the node to remove

Returns

The new node

removeNodeByID
this.removeNodeByID = id =>

Removes a node from the graph.

Usage
graph.removeNodeByID('a');
Parameters
id

the ID of the node to remove

Returns

Returns true if the node was successfully deleted.

reset
this.reset = _ =>

Resets the graph by removing all nodes.

Usage
graph.reset();
removeEdge
this.removeEdge = (
startID,
endID
) =>

Removes an edge from the graph.

Usage
graph.removeEdge('a');
Parameters
startID

the ID of the node on one side of the edge

endID

the ID of the node on the other side of the edge

Returns

Returns true if the edge was successfully deleted.

createUndirectedEdge
this.createUndirectedEdge = (
nodeID1,
nodeID2
) =>

Creates an undirected edge in the graph.

Usage
graph.createUndirectedEdge('a', 'b');
Parameters
nodeID1

the ID of the node on one side of the edge.

nodeID2

the ID of the node on the other side of the edge.

Returns

Returns true if the edge was successfully created.
